execution_summary: We generated a Dockerfile and built a Python 3.10 environment with pandas, numpy, statsmodels, pyreadr, matplotlib, and seaborn. The original plan referenced a missing Python entrypoint; we created a Python translation (replicate_hossain2020__py.py) and utilities (utils_io__py.py) to implement the preregistered OLS on the post-original COVID window (2020-04-04 to 2020-08-11) using the provided dataset. After resolving runtime issues related to statsmodels returning numpy arrays (fixes to result export and plotting), we executed the analysis inside the container. The data were loaded from /app/data/COVID replication.rds, variables were prepared as specified (cases per million, democracy scaled to EIU 0–10, temperature, openness), listwise deletion yielded n=150. The OLS with heteroskedasticity-robust (HC1) SEs produced a positive but statistically insignificant coefficient for democracy. Outputs (CSV, JSON summary, and coefficient plot) were saved to /app/data. No further deviations from the preregistration were required.

code_executed.logs: Base image python:3.10-slim; installed git, wget; pip installed pandas>=2.0.3, numpy>=1.24.0, statsmodels>=0.14.0, pyreadr>=0.4.9, matplotlib>=3.7.2, seaborn>=0.12.2.
code_executed.environment: Dockerized Python 3.10 slim with pandas, numpy, statsmodels, pyreadr, matplotlib, seaborn

code_executed.logs: Container replication-runner started; volumes mounted for /workspace and /app/data.

Loaded dataset; detected columns: COVID.04.04_08.11, popData2019, Democracy index (EIU), Annual_temp, trade.2016. Democracy scaled from 0–100 to 0–10. n=150 after listwise deletion. OLS (HC1) ran with R-squared=0.010; democracy coef=46.35 (SE=191.33, t=0.242, p=0.809). Artifacts saved to /app/data.
code_executed.environment: Python 3.10 with pandas, numpy, statsmodels (HC1 robust SEs), seaborn/matplotlib

results.hypothesis_tested: Across countries, a one-unit increase in the democracy index (EIU scale 0–10) is associated with a higher number of confirmed COVID-19 infections per one million people, measured over the post-original time window (2020-04-04 to 2020-08-11).

findings_summary.outcome_name: Coefficient on democracy (EIU 0–10) in OLS of cases per million

findings_summary.p_value: const p=0.090; temp p=0.937; open p=0.247

tables.table_description: HC1-robust OLS coefficients and 95% CIs for democracy, temperature, and openness.
JSON with R-squared and number of observations.

figures.figure_description: Point estimates with 95% confidence intervals for predictors (intercept excluded).
